question_text: Has the occupier obtained previous permission from the Chief Inspector of Factories for the site, construction, or extension of the factory using Form 1?
applicability_criteria: All factories proposing new construction, extension, or use of existing premises
simplified_guidance:
1. Submit an application in Form 1 to the Chief Inspector of Factories.
2. Attach a flow chart of the manufacturing process and list of raw materials/products.
3. Attach plans in duplicate showing the site, immediate surroundings, and building details.
4. Ensure plans indicate lighting, ventilation, and means of escape.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Approved building plans signed by the Chief Inspector; Copy of submitted Form 1

legal_text: An application for obtaining previous permission for the site on which the factory is to be situated and for the construction or extension of a factory shall be made to the Chief Inspector of Factories. Application for such permission shall be made in Form I...

question_text: Is a valid Certificate of Stability in Form 1-A available for all factory buildings and engineering constructions, approved by the Chief Inspector?
applicability_criteria: All factories carrying out manufacturing processes in constructed, reconstructed, or extended premises
simplified_guidance:
1. Obtain a Certificate of Stability in Form 1-A from a competent person (e.g., Structural Engineer).
2. Submit the certificate to the Chief Inspector of Factories for approval.
3. Ensure the certificate covers all buildings, tanks, silos, chimneys, and supporting structures.
4. Renew this certificate every 5 years or after any extension/alteration/repair.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Certificate of Stability in Form 1-A signed by a competent person and approved by the Chief Inspector
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Correspondence with a competent person regarding structural assessment

legal_text: No manufacturing process shall be carried out in any premises of a factory constructed, reconstructed or extended or in any premises which has been taken into use as a factory or part of a factory until a certificate of stability issued by a competent person in respect of every work of engineering construction in the Form 1-A has been sent by the Occupier of the factory to the Chief Inspector of Factories, and approved by him... Provided further that no manufacturing process shall be carried out in any premises of a factory unless a fresh certificate of stability in Form 1-A is obtained from a competent person once in each period of 5 years...

question_text: Does the occupier possess a valid licence obtained under Rule 6 or renewed under Rule 8 prior to using the premises as a factory?
applicability_criteria: All occupiers using any premises as a factory
simplified_guidance:
1. Ensure plans are approved regarding site, buildings, and layout.
2. Ensure factory construction conforms to approved plans.
3. Pay necessary fees and obtain the licence from the Chief Inspector.
4. Ensure the licence covers the correct number of workers and installed power.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Original Factory Licence (Form 4) valid for the current period
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Proof of application for licence submitted prior to commencement

legal_text: No occupier shall use any premises as a factory unless... A licence is obtained under rule 6 from the Chief Inspector of Factories or renewed under rule 8 by the Deputy Chief Inspector of Factories and the said licence is valid at the relevant time...

question_text: Has the application for registration (Form 2) and grant of licence (Form 3) been submitted with the appropriate fees?
applicability_criteria: New factories or factories seeking initial registration/licensing
simplified_guidance:
1. Submit Form 2 (Application for Registration and Notice of Occupation) in triplicate.
2. Submit Form 3 (Application for Licence).
3. Pay fees as per the Schedule (based on Horse Power and number of workers) via treasury receipt or cheque.
4. Ensure the period applied for does not exceed 10 years.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copies of Form 2 and Form 3; Fee payment receipts (Treasury challan or Cheque)

legal_text: The occupier or manager of every factory coming within this scope of this Act after its commencement shall submit to the Chief Inspector an application in triplicate in Form 2 for the registration of the factory accompanied by an application in Form 3 for the grant of licence therefor...

question_text: Has the licence been amended for any changes in factory name, site, installed power, or number of employees exceeding current limits?
applicability_criteria: Factories where changes in name, location, HP installed, or manpower limits occurred
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify if current parameters exceed limits specified in the existing licence.
2. Submit the original licence to the Chief Inspector with an application stating the nature of the amendment.
3. Pay the difference in fees if the change involves a higher bracket of workers or power.
4. Obtain the amended licence.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Amended Licence (Form 4) reflecting current operational status; Fee payment receipt for amendment
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Application for amendment submitted to Chief Inspector

legal_text: A licensee shall be required to have his licence amended if there is change in the name of the factory or in the site on which the factory is situated or if the factory for which the licence is granted exceeds the limits specified in the licence in regard to horse-power or the number of persons employed...

question_text: Is the application for renewal of licence submitted in Form 3 at least two months before expiry?
applicability_criteria: All licensed factories (Annual or periodic requirement)
simplified_guidance:
1. Fill out Form 3 for renewal.
2. Attach the original licence and treasury receipt/cheque for fees.
3. Submit to the Chief Inspector not later than two months before the expiry date (usually by Oct 31st).
4. If submitted late, pay the additional graded fees (5% to 25%) as per the Schedule.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Acknowledged copy of Form 3; Proof of fee payment; Endorsed Licence (Form 4)
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Challan showing payment of additional fee for late renewal

legal_text: An application for the renewal of licence... shall be made to Chief Inspector... in Form 3 accompanied by a treasury receipt... so as to reach him not later than two months before the date on which the licence is due to expire...

question_text: Has the Notice of Occupation been submitted in Form 2 correctly?
applicability_criteria: All factories (at least 15 days before occupying premises or using as factory)
simplified_guidance:
1. Complete Form 2 containing details of occupier, manager, and process.
2. Submit to the Chief Inspector of Factories.
3. Ensure this is done before occupying the premises for use as a factory.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of Form 2 with acknowledgment of receipt
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Proof of dispatch (Registered Post/Courier) of Form 2

legal_text: The notice of occupation shall be in Form 2.

question_text: Has the Notice of Change of Manager been submitted in Form 5 within the prescribed time?
applicability_criteria: Factories where the designated Manager has changed
simplified_guidance:
1. Complete Form 5 upon the appointment of a new Manager.
2. Submit the form to the Inspectorate.
3. Ensure submission is within 7 days of the change (as per Section 7(4) of the Act).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of Form 5 submitted to the Inspectorate
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Internal appointment letter of the new manager

legal_text: Notice of change of Manager shall be in Form 5.

question_text: If the factory operations are suspended, has the written intention to suspend the licence been notified before October 31st?
applicability_criteria: Factories intending to suspend operations/use of premises for the following year
simplified_guidance:
1. Determine if the factory will not be used in the coming year.
2. Notify the Chief Inspector in writing before 31st October.
3. Request suspension of the licence to avoid full renewal fees.
4. Note that reactivation requires Form 3 and a 10% surcharge.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Written notice of suspension submitted before Oct 31st

legal_text: If before the 31st October of any year an occupier notifies his intention in writing... that during the following year the premises... will not be used for the working of the factory, the Chief Inspector... may suspend the licence...

question_text: Is the Register of lime-washing, painting, and varnishing maintained in Form 8 with up-to-date entries?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Maintain a register in Form 8.
2. Record the dates on which lime-washing, color-washing, painting, or varnishing is carried out.
3. Ensure entries correspond to the frequency required (e.g., white-washing every 14 months, painting every 5 years).
4. Keep the register available for inspection.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 8 (Record of lime-washing, painting, etc.) with recent entries
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Work orders or invoices for painting/whitewashing services

legal_text: The record of dates on which white-washing, colour-washing, varnishing, etc., are carried out shall be entered in a Register maintained in Form 8.

question_text: Has approval been obtained from the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board for the treatment and disposal of trade waste and effluents?
applicability_criteria: Factories located in areas notified under the Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify if the factory generates trade waste or effluents.
2. Apply to the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) for approval.
3. Implement the approved treatment and disposal arrangements.
4. Maintain valid consent to operate documentation.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Consent to Operate / Approval letter from Maharashtra Pollution Control Board

legal_text: For the areas notified under Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, (6 of 1974) necessary approval to arrangements made for the treatment and disposal of all types of trade-waste and effluents shall be obtained from Maharashtra Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Board, constituted under that Act.

question_text: Is the wet-bulb temperature in workrooms maintained below 30°C with adequate air movement?
applicability_criteria: All factories (except those specifically exempted or covered by Section 15)
simplified_guidance:
1. Measure the wet-bulb temperature in workrooms at a height of 1.5 meters.
2. Ensure it does not exceed 30°C.
3. Ensure air movement is at least 30 meters per minute.
4. If outside wet-bulb temp exceeds 27°C, apply the schedule allowances.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Temperature records; Hygrometer readings; Presence of adequate fans/ventilation

legal_text: In any factory the maximum wet-bulb temperature of air in a work-room at a height of 1.5 metres above the floor level shall not exceed 30 degrees C and adequate air movement of at least 30 meters per minute shall be provided...

question_text: Does the aggregate area of ventilation openings in workrooms meet the minimum requirement of 15% of the floor area?
applicability_criteria: All factories (unless mechanically ventilated or air-conditioned)
simplified_guidance:
1. Calculate the floor area of the workroom.
2. Measure the area of windows, ventilators, and other openings.
3. Ensure the total opening area is at least 15% of the floor area.
4. If natural ventilation is insufficient, provide mechanical ventilation.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Building plans showing ventilation calculations; Physical verification of openings
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Plan for installing additional ventilation or mechanical systems

legal_text: In every factory the number of ventilation openings in the workroom below the caves shall, except where mechanical means of ventilation... are provided be of an aggregate area of not less than 15 per cent of the floor area and so located as to afford a continued supply of fresh air...

question_text: In factories using artificial humidification, is the Humidity Register in Form 9 maintained with daily readings?
applicability_criteria: Cotton spinning and weaving mills using artificial humidification
simplified_guidance:
1. Record wet and dry bulb temperatures daily.
2. Take readings between 7-9 am, 11 am-2 pm, and 4-5:30 pm.
3. Enter readings in Form 9.
4. Ensure the person taking readings signs the register monthly.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 9 (Humidity Register) with daily entries

legal_text: At each hygrometer... correct wet and dry bulb temperatures shall be recorded daily during working hours... The temperatures shall be entered in a Humidity Register in Form 9 maintained in the factory.

question_text: Are sufficient hygrometers provided and maintained in departments using artificial humidification?
applicability_criteria: Cotton spinning and weaving mills with artificial humidification
simplified_guidance:
1. Install hygrometers in all departments with artificial humidification.
2. Follow the scale: One per 500 looms (weaving) or one per 8,500 cu. meters (other depts).
3. Ensure one hygrometer is provided outside for shade readings.
4. Keep hygrometers in efficient working order.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Presence of functional hygrometers in specified locations

legal_text: In all departments of cotton spinning and weaving mills wherein artificial humidification is adopted, hygrometers shall be provided and maintained... The number of hygrometers shall be regulated according to the following scale...

question_text: Is the lighting intensity in all parts of the factory maintained as per the minimum Lux levels specified in Schedule A?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Measure illumination levels in various work areas.
2. Compare against Schedule A (e.g., 20 Lux for stockyards, 50 Lux for passageways, 100 Lux for engine rooms).
3. Ensure lighting is uniform and free from glare.
4. Install additional lighting if daylight is insufficient.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Lux meter survey report; Visual inspection of lighting

legal_text: The minimum intensity of illumination for the different areas and work-rooms of the type given under column No.2 shall be as given under column No.3 of the Schedule 'A' appended hereto...

question_text: Are local lights provided with suitable shades to prevent glare to the eyes of the workers?
applicability_criteria: Workstations using local/focused artificial lighting
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify local lights used for specific tasks.
2. Check if they have opaque shades or screens.
3. Ensure the light source is screened from the eyes of the worker at the normal working position.
4. Adjust positioning to avoid direct glare.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Presence of shades on task lighting

legal_text: Any local light... shall be provided with a suitable shade of opaque material to prevent glare or with other effective means by which the light source is completely screened from the eyes of every person employed at a normal working place...

question_text: Is the compound surrounding the factory maintained in a clean and sanitary condition?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect the factory compound/surroundings.
2. Ensure it is free from rubbish, filth, or debris.
3. Establish a routine cleaning schedule for outdoor areas.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Visual cleanliness of the premises

legal_text: The compound surrounding every factory shall be maintained in a sanitary and clean condition free of rubbish, filth or debris.

question_text: Is drinking water provided at a rate of at least five liters per day per worker and readily available during working hours?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Calculate the total number of workers.
2. Ensure the drinking water supply capacity meets the minimum of 5 liters per worker per day.
3. Ensure water is available at all times during working hours.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Water storage capacity records; Visual verification of supply
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Purchase orders for additional water supply

legal_text: The quantity of drinking water to be provided for the workers in every factory shall be at least five litres a day per worker employed in the factory and such drinking water shall be readily available at all times during working hours.

question_text: If drinking water is supplied from a well or reservoir, is it sterilized at least once a week?
applicability_criteria: Factories supplying drinking water from wells or reservoirs (not treated/filtered to Health Officer satisfaction)
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify the source of drinking water.
2. If from a well/reservoir, sterilize the water once a week.
3. Maintain a record of the dates on which sterilization is carried out.
4. This is not required if water is filtered/treated to the satisfaction of the Health Officer.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Sterilization logbook/register

legal_text: Where drinking water is supplied from such well or reservoir the water in it shall be sterilised once a week or more frequently if the Inspector by written order so requires, and the date on which sterilising is carried out shall be recorded...

question_text: Is the drinking water supplied to workers cooled by ice or other effective methods from 1st March to 30th November?
applicability_criteria: Factories ordinarily employing more than 250 workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify if the factory employs more than 250 workers.
2. Ensure cooling arrangements (water coolers, ice, etc.) are active between March 1 and November 30.
3. Establish 'Water Centers' in canteens, lunchrooms, and accessible points.
4. Ensure ice, if used, is from an approved source.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Functioning water coolers; Temperature check log; Source approval for ice

legal_text: In every factory wherein more than 250 workers are ordinarily employed... the drinking water supplied to the workers shall from the 1st of March to 30th of November in every year be cooled by ice or other effective method...

question_text: Is adequate latrine accommodation provided separately for males and females according to the prescribed scale?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Count workers by gender.
2. Provide 1 latrine per 25 females.
3. Provide 1 latrine per 25 males (up to 100 males), then 1 per 50 thereafter.
4. Count odd numbers less than 25/50 as a full unit.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Physical count of functional latrines; Layout plan

legal_text: Latrine accommodation shall be provided in every factory on the following scale: (a) where females are employed, there shall be at least one latrine for every 25 females; (b) where males are employed... one latrine for 25 males up to the first 100, and one for every 50 thereafter.

question_text: Is adequate urinal accommodation provided for male workers according to the prescribed scale?
applicability_criteria: All factories employing male workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Count male workers employed at a time.
2. Provide 1 urinal for every 50 males (up to 500 males).
3. Provide 1 urinal for every 100 males thereafter.
4. Ensure urinals are connected to the drainage system.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Physical count of urinals

legal_text: There shall be at least one urinal for every 50 male workers or part thereof employed at a time; provided that where the number of males employed exceeds 500 it shall be sufficient if there is one urinal for every 50 males up to the first 500 and one for every 100 or part thereof thereafter.

question_text: Are latrines and urinals white-washed or color-washed at least once every four months, and is the record maintained in Form 8?
applicability_criteria: All factories (Except those with glazed tile walls/ceilings washed with detergents)
simplified_guidance:
1. White-wash or color-wash latrine/urinal walls, ceilings, and partitions.
2. Repeat this at least once every four months.
3. Record the dates of washing in Form 8.
4. Exemption applies if walls/ceilings are glazed tiles and washed with disinfectants.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 8 Register with entries every 4 months

legal_text: The walls, ceiling and partition of every latrine and urinal shall be white-washed or colour washed and the white-washing or colour-washing shall be repeated at least once in every period of four months. The dates on which the white-washing or colour-washing is carried out shall be entered in the prescribed Register in Form 8...

question_text: Are water taps provided in or near latrine accommodation at the rate of one tap for every ten latrines?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Provide conveniently accessible water taps near latrines.
2. Ensure the ratio is at least 1 tap per 10 latrines.
3. Connect taps to a continuous water supply or overhead tank.
4. Ensure water is available during all working hours.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Visual verification of taps and water flow

legal_text: Water taps, conveniently accessible, shall be provided in or near such latrine accommodation. There shall be at least one tap for every ten latrines or part thereof.

question_text: Are sufficient sweepers employed to maintain latrines, urinals, and wash places in a clean condition as per the prescribed schedule?
applicability_criteria: All factories (Scale based on workers per shift)
simplified_guidance:
1. Check the number of workers in each shift.
2. Employ sweepers as per Schedule: 
   - Upto 100 workers: 1 part-time
   - 101-250: 1 full-time
   - 251-500: 2 full-time
   - 501-1000: 3 full-time
3. Ensure they clean latrines, urinals, and wash places.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Muster roll showing employment of sweepers; Cleaning schedule/log

legal_text: In every factory employing number of workers in any shift as shown in column No. 2 of the Schedule... there shall be employed at least a number of full time/part time sweepers as shown in column No.3... to clean the latrines, urinals and wash places...

question_text: Are sufficient spittoons provided in convenient locations and maintained in a clean and hygienic condition?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Install spittoons on stands/brackets 90cm high.
2. Use galvanized iron containers with disinfectant or sand-filled containers.
3. Ensure they are cleaned/emptied daily.
4. Verify locations are sufficient to the satisfaction of the Inspector.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Presence of clean spittoons; Cleaning log (optional)

legal_text: The number and location of the spittoons to be provided shall be to the satisfaction of the Inspector. Such spittoons shall be placed on a stand or a bracket 90 centimetres high... The spittoons... shall be emptied, cleaned and disinfected at least once every day...

question_text: In textile factories, are openers, scutchers, and carding machines provided with effective interlocking arrangements to prevent access to dangerous parts while in motion?
applicability_criteria: Textile factories (Cotton, Silk, Asbestos, Fibre, Jute) using openers, scutchers, or carding machines
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect covers and doors of openers, scutchers, and lap machines.
2. Verify that the machine cannot start if the cover is open.
3. Verify that the cover cannot be opened until the machine comes to a complete rest.
4. Check carding machines for similar automatic locking devices on cylinder doors.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Functional interlocking system on specified machines
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Maintenance log showing repair of interlocks

legal_text: In all openers, scutchers, combined openers and scutchers, scutcher lap machines... the beater covers and doors which give access to any dangerous part of the machine shall be fitted with effective interlocking arrangements, which shall prevent the covers and doors being opened till the dangerous parts of the machine come to rest and also prevent the machine being restarted till the covers and doors are closed.

question_text: Are circular saws equipped with a riving knife, a top guard, and push sticks to prevent injury?
applicability_criteria: Factories using wood-working machinery (Circular Saws)
simplified_guidance:
1. Ensure a riving knife is placed behind the saw in direct line.
2. Check that the top guard covers the saw and extends below the roots of the teeth.
3. Verify push sticks are available for use.
4. Ensure the floor around the machine is not slippery.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Presence of riving knife, guard, and push sticks on circular saws

legal_text: Every circular saw shall be fenced as follows:-(a) Behind and in direct line with the saw there shall be an arriving knife... (b) The top of the saw shall be covered by a strong and easily adjustable guard... A push stick or other suitable appliance shall be provided for use at every circular saw...

question_text: Are rubber and plastic mills equipped with safety trip rods or tight wire cables to instantly stop the machine?
applicability_criteria: Factories using Rubber or Plastic Mills
simplified_guidance:
1. Locate the safety trip rods or tight wire cables across the front and rear of the rolls.
2. Ensure they are within reach of the operator (not more than 170 cm above floor).
3. Test the device to ensure it instantly disconnects power and applies brakes.
4. Maintain a daily record of these tests.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Functional safety trip wires; Daily examination log
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Maintenance request for safety device repair

legal_text: Rubber and Plastic Mills shall be equipped with... Horizontal Safety - trip rods or tight wire cable across both front and rear, which will when pushed or pulled operate instantly to disconnect the power and apply the brakes or to reverse the rolls.

question_text: Are centrifugal machines provided with interlocking lids that prevent opening while the drum is in motion?
applicability_criteria: Factories using Centrifugal Machines (extractors, separators, driers)
simplified_guidance:
1. Check if the lid is interlocked with the drive mechanism.
2. Attempt to open the lid while the drum is rotating (it should not open).
3. Attempt to start the machine with the lid open (it should not start).
4. Ensure the safe working speed is stamped on the machine.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Functional interlock on centrifugal machine lids

legal_text: Centrifugal machines shall be provided with efficient inter locking devices that will physically prevent the lids from being opened whilst the rotating drums or brackets are in motion... and would also prevent the starting of the drums or baskets under power while the lids are open.

question_text: Are shears, slitters, and guillotine machines provided with barrier guards or suitable starting devices to protect the operator's hands?
applicability_criteria: Factories using shears, slitters, or guillotine machines (metal, paper, leather, etc.)
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect the front of the knife/blade.
2. Ensure a barrier metal guard prevents hands from reaching the blade.
3. Alternatively, check for simultaneous two-hand controls or automatic sweep devices.
4. Ensure the back end is also guarded to prevent access.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Installed barrier guards or functional two-hand controls

legal_text: A barrier metal guard of adequate strength shall be provided at the front of the knife... and shall be so fixed as would prevent any part of the operator's body to reach the descending blade... or there shall be provided suitable starting devices which require simultaneous action of both the hands of the operator...

question_text: Is the register of specially trained adult workers attending to machinery maintained in Form 10?
applicability_criteria: Factories where workers are required to examine, lubricate, or adjust machinery while in motion
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify workers authorized to attend to moving machinery (as per Section 22).
2. Ensure their names are entered in Form 10.
3. Verify they have received specific training.
4. Ensure they are adult males.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 10 (Register of workers attending to machinery) updated

legal_text: Register of workers attending to machinery as provided in sub-section (1) of section 22 shall be in Form 10.

question_text: Are workers who attend to moving machinery provided with and wearing tight-fitting clothing?
applicability_criteria: Workers required to attend to machinery in motion (lubrication, adjustment)
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify provision of tight-fitting clothing (shorts/vests/shirts) by the occupier.
2. Ensure clothing fits closely to prevent entanglement.
3. Observe workers during operations to ensure compliance.
4. Ensure clothing is returned/replaced as necessary.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Workers wearing tight-fitting clothing; Stock records of clothing issued

legal_text: A worker required to wear tight fitting clothing under sub-section (1) of section 22 shall be provided by the occupier with such clothing which shall consist of at least a pair of closely fitting shorts and a closely fitting half sleeves shirt or vest.

question_text: Are young persons prohibited from working on dangerous machines unless fully instructed and supervised?
applicability_criteria: Factories employing young persons
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify 'dangerous machines' (Power presses, Milling machines, Guillotines, Circular saws, Platen printing).
2. Ensure no young person works at these unless fully instructed on dangers/precautions.
3. Ensure they have received sufficient training or are under adequate supervision.
4. Verify records of training for young persons.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Training records for young persons; Supervision logs

legal_text: The machines specified in sections 28, 29 and 30 and the following machines shall be deemed to be of such dangerous character that young persons shall not work at them unless the provisions of section 23(1) are complied with:- Power presses other than hydraulic presses; Milling machines used in the metal trades; Guillotine machines; Circular saws; Platen printing machines.

question_text: Are all belts examined regularly to ensure joints are safe and tension is proper?
applicability_criteria: Factories using belt drives
simplified_guidance:
1. Implement a schedule for belt examination.
2. Check for safe joints (no protruding metal fasteners for overhead belts).
3. Ensure proper tension to prevent slippage or breakage.
4. Maintain a record of examinations.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Belt examination maintenance records

legal_text: All belts shall be regularly examined to ensure that joints are safe and the belts are at proper tension.

meta_data.category: Safety - Lifting Gear and Pressure Plant

question_text: Is the register for recording particulars of examinations of hoists and lifts maintained in Form 11?
applicability_criteria: Factories using hoists or lifts
simplified_guidance:
1. Maintain a register in Form 11 for all hoists and lifts.
2. Ensure a competent person examines the hoist/lift periodically (typically every 6 months as per Act section 28).
3. Record the details of examinations, defects found, and repairs in the register.
4. Keep the register available for inspection.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 11 Register with up-to-date entries signed by a competent person
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Maintenance logs or service contracts for lifts

legal_text: A Register shall be maintained to record particulars of examinations of hoists or lifts and shall give particulars as shown in Form 11.

meta_data.category: Safety - Lifting Gear and Pressure Plant

question_text: Has every lifting machine, chain, rope, and lifting tackle been tested and examined by a competent person before being taken into use for the first time?
applicability_criteria: Factories using lifting machines, chains, ropes, or lifting tackles
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify all new lifting gears and machines.
2. Ensure they are tested by a competent person before first use.
3. Obtain a certificate specifying the safe working load.
4. Ensure the certificate is signed by the person making the test.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Test certificates for all lifting gears signed by a competent person

legal_text: No lifting machine and no chain, rope of lifting tackle except a fibre rope or fibre rope sling shall be taken in use in any factory, for the first time therein unless it has been tested and all parts have been thoroughly examined by a competent person and a certificate of such test examination specifying the safe working load or loads... has been obtained...

meta_data.category: Safety - Lifting Gear and Pressure Plant

question_text: Is the Register of examinations for lifting machines, chains, ropes, and lifting tackles maintained in Form 12?
applicability_criteria: Factories using lifting machines and tackles
simplified_guidance:
1. Keep a register in Form 12.
2. Record details of every examination made under Rule 64.
3. Ensure entries include dates of testing, annealing, and safe working loads.
4. Keep the register readily available for inspection.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 12 Register with regular entries

legal_text: A Register in Form 12 containing the particulars, therein specified shall be kept of every examination made under sub-rule (1). The Register shall be readily available for inspection.

meta_data.category: Safety - Lifting Gear and Pressure Plant

question_text: Is the safe working load (SWL) plainly marked on every lifting machine, chain, rope, and lifting tackle?
applicability_criteria: Factories using lifting gears
simplified_guidance:
1. Check every lifting machine and tackle for SWL markings.
2. Ensure the marking is legible and plainly visible.
3. For multiple slings, ensure the table shows SWL at different angles.
4. Post a table of SWL in the store-room for chains/ropes not individually marked.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Visible SWL markings on equipment; Displayed SWL charts

legal_text: No rope, chain or lifting tackle not shown in the table shall be used in a factory unless in the case of lifting tackle, the safe working load thereof, or in the case of a multiple sling, the safe working load at different angles of the legs, is plainly marked upto it.

meta_data.category: Safety - Lifting Gear and Pressure Plant

question_text: Are chains and lifting tackles annealed under competent supervision at the prescribed intervals?
applicability_criteria: Factories using chains/lifting tackles (except those exempt under sub-rule 6)
simplified_guidance:
1. Anneal chains/slings used with molten metal or of 1/2 inch bar or smaller every 6 months.
2. Anneal all other general use chains/rings/hooks every 12 months.
3. Ensure annealing is done under the supervision of a competent person.
4. Record particulars in Form 12.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 12 entries regarding annealing dates and supervisor signature

legal_text: All chains and lifting tackle, except a rope sling, shall, unless they have been subjected to such other heat treatment as may be approved by the State Government be effectively annealed under the supervision of a competent person at the following intervals...

meta_data.category: Safety - Lifting Gear and Pressure Plant

question_text: Are pressure vessels fitted with a suitable safety valve, pressure gauge, stop valve, and drain cock?
applicability_criteria: Factories operating pressure plants/vessels above atmospheric pressure
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect each pressure vessel.
2. Verify presence of a suitable safety valve to prevent over-pressure.
3. Verify presence of a pressure gauge (dial range 1.5 to 2 times max pressure).
4. Ensure stop valves and drain cocks are fitted.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Installed and functional safety fittings on vessels
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Maintenance requisition for replacement of faulty gauges/valves

legal_text: Every pressure plant or pressure vessel shall be fitted with-(a) a suitable safety valve... (b) a suitable pressure gauge... (c) a suitable stop valve... (e) a suitable drain cock or valve...

meta_data.category: Safety - Lifting Gear and Pressure Plant

question_text: Is every pressure plant thoroughly examined by a competent person at the prescribed intervals (External, Internal, Hydraulic)?
applicability_criteria: Factories with pressure plants in service
simplified_guidance:
1. Ensure external examination every 6 months.
2. Ensure internal examination every 12 months.
3. Ensure hydraulic test once every 4 years.
4. If internal exam is not possible, ensure hydraulic test every 2 years.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Examination reports signed by a competent person

legal_text: Ever pressure plant in service shall be thoroughly examined by a competent person,-(a) externally once in every period of six months; (b) internally, once in every period of twelve months, and (c) hydraulic test once in a period of four years.

meta_data.category: Safety - Lifting Gear and Pressure Plant

question_text: Is the maximum safe working pressure and the date of the last examination marked on every pressure vessel?
applicability_criteria: All pressure vessels/plants
simplified_guidance:
1. Check the body/plate of the pressure vessel.
2. Verify that the maximum safe working pressure is legible.
3. Verify that the date of the last examination is marked.
4. Ensure the vessel is not operated above this pressure.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Visible markings on pressure vessels

legal_text: The maximum safe working pressure and the date of the last examination shall be plainly marked on every pressure vessel or pressure plant and no pressure plant or pressure vessel shall be operated or used at a pressure higher than the maximum safe working pressure.

meta_data.category: Safety - Lifting Gear and Pressure Plant

question_text: Is the report of the result of every examination of pressure vessels completed in Form 13?
applicability_criteria: Factories with pressure plants
simplified_guidance:
1. Obtain the report from the competent person after examination.
2. Ensure it is in the prescribed Form 13.
3. Check that it is signed by the competent person.
4. Maintain these reports in the factory register.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 13 reports

legal_text: The report of the result of every examination made shall be completed in Form 13.

meta_data.category: Safety - Lifting Gear and Pressure Plant

question_text: Where source pressure is higher than the safe working pressure of the vessel, is a suitable reducing valve and pressure gauge provided?
applicability_criteria: Pressure vessels connected to a supply source with higher pressure
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify vessels connected to high-pressure supply lines.
2. Check for a reducing valve between the source and the vessel.
3. Ensure a pressure gauge is provided close to the reducing valve.
4. Ensure an automatic device prevents safe working pressure from being exceeded.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Installation of reducing valves and gauges

legal_text: Every pressure plant or pressure vessel not constructed to withstand the maximum possible working pressure at the source of supply... shall be fitted with a suitable reducing valve or other suitable automatic device... Suitable pressure guages shall be provided close to the reducing valve...

question_text: Are there at least two ways of escape from every room, and does the travel distance to the nearest exit not exceed 30 meters?
applicability_criteria: All factory buildings
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify that every room has at least two exits remotely located from each other.
2. Measure the travel distance from the furthest point in the room to the exit.
3. Ensure the distance is 30 meters or less (22.5 meters for high hazard areas).
4. Ensure exits lead continuously to the exterior.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Floor plans showing exit routes; Physical measurement of travel distances
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Architectural modification plans for additional exits

legal_text: Exit shall be so located that the travel distance to reach at least one of them on the floor shall not exceed 30 metres... There shall not be less than two exits serving every floor area above and below the ground floors...

question_text: Are portable fire extinguishers provided at a rate of one for every 500 square meters of floor area?
applicability_criteria: Factories with more than 100 square meters floor area
simplified_guidance:
1. Calculate the total floor area.
2. Ensure at least one extinguisher is provided for every 500 sq. meters.
3. Verify extinguishers are spaced not more than 30 meters apart.
4. Ensure appropriate types (CO2, Foam, Powder) are used based on fire class.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Extinguisher inventory and location map

legal_text: In factories having more than 100 square metres floor area... portable extinguishers at the rate of one for every 500 squ. metres of area spaced at not more than 30 metres apart subject to a minimum of one extinguisher shall be provided...

question_text: Are fire buckets provided at the rate of two buckets for every 100 square meters of floor area?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Ensure 2 fire buckets (9 liters capacity) are provided per 100 sq. meters.
2. Ensure a minimum of 4 buckets per floor.
3. Check if they are painted red and kept full of water or sand (for oil/chemical risks).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Presence of filled fire buckets in designated positions

legal_text: Two fire buckets of not less than 9 litres capacity for every 100 square metres of floor area subject to a minimum of four buckets on each floor.

question_text: Are workers prevented from lifting or carrying loads exceeding the maximum prescribed weight limits?
applicability_criteria: All factories where manual transport of loads occurs
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify that adult males do not lift more than 55 kg.
2. Verify that adult females do not lift more than 30 kg.
3. Ensure young persons (15-18 years) do not lift more than 30 kg (male) or 20 kg (female).
4. Provide mechanical aids for heavier loads.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Observation of manual handling practices; Weighing records of standard packages

legal_text: No person, unaided by another person, or mechanical aid, be required or allowed to lift, put down, carry or move any load... exceeding the maximum limit in weight, as set out in the following SCHEDULE... (A) Adult male 55.00...

question_text: Are effective screens or suitable goggles provided for protection of eyes in specified processes?
applicability_criteria: Processes involving welding, grinding, cutting, or exposure to excessive light/heat (Schedules I & II)
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify processes like welding, fettling, grinding, or chemical handling.
2. Verify provision of goggles or screens for workers.
3. Ensure workers are actually using them.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Workers wearing PPE; Stock records of eye protection gear

legal_text: Effective screens or suitable goggles shall be provided for the protection of persons employed in or in the immediate vicinity of the following processes...

question_text: Do manholes for confined spaces conform to the minimum dimension requirements?
applicability_criteria: Factories with confined spaces like tanks, vats, pipes, flues
simplified_guidance:
1. Measure manhole openings.
2. Ensure rectangular/oval shapes are at least 40cm x 30cm (approx based on shoulder width + 8cm).
3. Ensure circular shapes are at least 40cm diameter (approx based on shoulder width + 8cm).
4. Ensure compliance before allowing entry.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Physical measurement of manhole dimensions

legal_text: In any factory no person shall be allowed or required to enter in any chamber... unless the said chamber... is provided with a man-hole... (a) in the case of rectangular or oval shape, be not less than shoulder width of the person concerned plus 8 c.m. in length and 30 c.m. wide...

question_text: Is a work permit system implemented for opening equipment or pipelines containing inflammable materials?
applicability_criteria: Factories where equipment/pipelines containing inflammable liquids/gases are opened
simplified_guidance:
1. Ensure no line is opened without a work permit.
2. Check for blanking and flushing operations certified by a supervisor.
3. Ensure permits are signed by Process and Engineering supervisors.
4. Verify gas testing before opening.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Completed Work Permits; Records of gas tests

legal_text: The system of work permits shall be introduced and unless the equipment or the pipeline is certified to be free of inflammable gas or liquid, no person shall be allowed to enter or open the same.

question_text: Are crawling boards used and work permits issued for work on fragile roofs?
applicability_criteria: Factories with fragile roofs (Asbestos cement, perspex, etc.)
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify roofs with fragile materials.
2. Ensure crawling boards or duck ladders are provided for work on such roofs.
3. Verify that a permit to work is issued each time work is required.
4. Ensure warning notices are displayed.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Fragile roof work permits; Inventory of crawling boards

legal_text: In any factory, no person shall be required to stand or pass over or work on or near any roof or ceiling covered with fragile material... unless-(a) suitable and sufficient ladders, duck ladders or crawling boards... are provided and used; and (b) a permit to work on the fragile roof is issued...

question_text: Is the water-sealed gas holder examined externally and internally by a competent person at prescribed intervals?
applicability_criteria: Factories with water-sealed gas holders (Capacity >140 cu.m)
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify external examination every 2 years.
2. Verify internal examination every 12 months.
3. Ensure internal examination includes thickness testing every 4 years.
4. Maintain Register in Form 13A and Report in Form 13B.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 13-B Examination Reports; Form 13-A Register

legal_text: No gas-holder shall be taken into use in any factory for the first time unless... certificate of its internal and external examination in Form 13B is obtained... Every gas-holder shall be thoroughly examined internally by a person competent to conduct such examination once in every period of twelve months.

question_text: Are ladders used for replacing belts provided with hooks or non-skid devices?
applicability_criteria: Factories where ladders are used for belt replacement work
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect ladders used for maintenance/belt replacement.
2. Ensure they have hooks to rest on the shaft.
3. Ensure they have non-skid devices at the bottom.
4. Designate specific ladders for this work.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Ladders equipped with safety hooks/feet

legal_text: All ladders used in replacing belts shall be specially made and reserved for that work and provided with hooks or an effective nonkid device.

question_text: Has the application for site appraisal been submitted to the Site Appraisal Committee for factories covered under section 2(cb)?
applicability_criteria: Factories covered under section 2(cb) (Hazardous Processes) seeking initial site appraisal
simplified_guidance:
1. Prepare the application in the format annexed to Rule 73-K.
2. Submit 15 copies to the Chairman of the Site Appraisal Committee.
3. Include details of the site, manufacturing process, hazardous materials, and emergency preparedness.
4. Ensure clearance is obtained before commencing operations.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Acknowledgement of application submission; Site Appraisal Committee approval letter

legal_text: Applications for appraisal of sites in respect of the factories covered under section 2(cb) of the Act shall be submitted to the Chairman of the Site Appraisal Committee... The application for site appraisal alongwith 15 copies thereof shall be submitted in the Form annexed to this rule.

question_text: Has a written Health and Safety Policy been prepared, signed by the occupier, and made available to workers and the Inspector?
applicability_criteria: Factories covered under Section 2(cb), or dangerous operations under Section 87, or employing 50+ workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Prepare a written statement of policy regarding health and safety.
2. Ensure it covers organizational set-up, worker involvement, and accountability.
3. Sign the policy (Occupier).
4. Display copies in conspicuous places and provide to workers.
5. Revise whenever significant changes or expansions occur.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Signed Health and Safety Policy; Proof of distribution/display

legal_text: Occupier of every factory... shall prepare a written statement of his policy in respect of health and safety of workers at work... A copy of the declared Health and Safety Policy signed by the Occupier shall be made available to the inspector having jurisdiction over the factory and to the Chief Inspector.

question_text: Are Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) available for every hazardous substance handled, and are containers properly labeled?
applicability_criteria: Factories carrying on a 'hazardous process'
simplified_guidance:
1. Obtain or develop MSDS for every hazardous substance used, stored, or transported.
2. Ensure MSDS follows the Schedule format (12 standard items).
3. Make MSDS accessible to workers.
4. Label every container with contents, manufacturer details, hazards, and PPE requirements.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Collection of MSDS; Visible labels on containers
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Request letters to suppliers for MSDS

legal_text: The occupier of every factory carrying on a 'hazardous process' shall arrange to obtain or develop information in the form of Material Safety Data Sheet in respect of every hazardous substance or material handled... Every container of a hazardous substance shall be clearly labelled or marked...

question_text: Has information regarding hazardous processes and safety measures been disclosed to all workers?
applicability_criteria: Factories carrying on a 'hazardous process'
simplified_guidance:
1. Compile information on hazards, safety measures, PPE, and emergency roles.
2. Supply this information to workers via booklets or leaflets.
3. Display cautionary notices at workplaces.
4. Ensure information is in a language understood by the majority of workers.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copies of booklets/leaflets issued; Photos of displayed notices; Worker acknowledgement records

legal_text: The occupier of a factory carrying on a 'Hazardous process' shall supply to all workers the following information in relation to handlings of hazardous materials... The information... shall be complied and made known to workers individually through supply of booklets or leaflets and display of cautionary notices...

question_text: Has the necessary information for the on-site emergency plan been disclosed to the District Emergency Authority?
applicability_criteria: Factories carrying on a 'hazardous process'
simplified_guidance:
1. Prepare a report on risk assessment, environmental impact, and possible accident sources.
2. Compile MSDS and resources available for emergencies.
3. Submit this information to the District Emergency Authority designated by the State Government.
4. Update this information annually or upon process changes.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Proof of submission to District Emergency Authority

legal_text: The occupier of a factory carrying on a hazardous process, shall intimate the District Emergency Authority designated by the State Government, all information having a bearing on preparation of an on-site emergency plan and a disaster control and management plan...

question_text: Is a Safety Committee constituted with equal representation from management and workers, meeting at least once every quarter?
applicability_criteria: Factories with 250+ workers OR 'hazardous process'/'dangerous operations' factories with 50+ workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Constitute a Safety Committee with equal representatives from management and workers.
2. Ensure the Chairman is a senior official and the Secretary is the Safety Officer (if available).
3. Ensure the committee meets at least once per quarter.
4. Record minutes of meetings.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Minutes of Safety Committee meetings; Constitution document

legal_text: In every factory... there shall be a Safety Committee... Safety Committee shall meet as often as necessary but at least once in every quarter. The minutes of the meeting shall be recorded and produced to the Inspector on demand.

question_text: Are workers in hazardous processes medically examined before employment and every 6 months thereafter, with records in Form 7?
applicability_criteria: Factories carrying on a 'hazardous process'
simplified_guidance:
1. Appoint a Factory Medical Officer.
2. Conduct pre-employment medical exams for fitness.
3. Conduct periodical exams every 6 months.
4. Maintain the Health Register in Form 7.
5. Ensure no one is employed without a Certificate of Fitness in Form 6.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Health Register (Form 7); Certificates of Fitness (Form 6)
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Appointment letter with medical clinic for upcoming exams

legal_text: Workers employed in a 'hazardous process' shall be medically examined... once before employment... once in a period of 6 months... the details of pre-employment and periodical medical examinations carried out as aforesaid shall be recorded in the Health Register in Form 7.

question_text: Is an Occupational Health Centre (OHC) provided and maintained with the required staff and equipment?
applicability_criteria: Factories carrying on a 'hazardous process'
simplified_guidance:
1. For up to 50 workers: Retainership with Factory Medical Officer + 5 trained first-aiders.
2. For 51-200 workers: OHC room (15 sq.m), part-time Medical Officer, dresser-cum-compounder.
3. For >200 workers: OHC (2 rooms), full-time Medical Officer (1 per 500), nurse, dresser, sweeper.
4. Ensure equipment is as per Schedule.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Physical verification of OHC and equipment; Staff attendance records

legal_text: In respect of any factory carrying on 'Hazardous Process' there shall be provided and maintained in good order an Occupational Health Centre with the services and facilities as per scale laid down hereunder...

question_text: Is a suitably equipped ambulance van provided and maintained for factories carrying on hazardous processes?
applicability_criteria: Factories carrying on a 'hazardous process' (Usually 200+ workers, or arrangement for <200)
simplified_guidance:
1. Provide an ambulance van equipped with oxygen, resuscitation unit, stretcher, etc.
2. Ensure it is manned by a full-time Driver-cum-Mechanic and Helper trained in first-aid.
3. Ensure it is stationed near the OHC.
4. For <200 workers, ensure valid arrangements with a nearby hospital/service are in place.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Ambulance van on premises; List of equipment inside; Agreement with hospital (if applicable)

legal_text: In any factory carrying on 'hazardous process', there shall be provided and maintained in good condition, a suitably constructed ambulance van equipped with items as per sub-rule (2) and manned by the full-time Driver-cum-Mechanic and Helper trained in first-aid...

question_text: Are decontamination facilities, including drenching showers and eye wash bottles, provided and accessible?
applicability_criteria: Factories carrying on a 'hazardous process'
simplified_guidance:
1. Provide fully equipped first-aid boxes.
2. Install drenching showers as per scale (2 for up to 50 workers, +1 for every additional 50/100).
3. Provide eye wash bottles/fountains in convenient locations.
4. Ensure clear signage for these facilities.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Functional showers and eye wash stations; Signage

legal_text: In every factory, carrying out 'hazardous process' the following provisions shall be made to meet emergency... readily accessible means of drenching with water... a sufficient number of eye wash bottle...

question_text: Are adequate washing facilities provided for workers, including separate enclosed facilities for female workers with proper signage?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Provide washing facilities at the scale of 1 for every 20 workers (up to 200) and 1 for every 50 thereafter.
2. Ensure facilities include soap, nail brushes, and water supply (30 liters/day/person).
3. Ensure separate, screened facilities for women with 'For Women Only' signage.
4. Maintain facilities in a clean and orderly condition.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Visual inspection of washing areas; Water supply records
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Plumbing diagrams or work orders for facility upgrades

legal_text: There shall be provided and maintained in every factory for the use of employed persons adequate and suitable facilities for washing which shall include soap and nail brushes... If female workers are employed, separate washing facilities shall be provided and so enclosed of screened... The entrance to such facilities shall bear conspicuous notice... 'For Women Only'...

question_text: Are facilities for storing street clothing and drying wet working clothing provided for workers in specified industries?
applicability_criteria: Factories listed in the Schedule (Engineering, Chemical, Iron/Steel, Oil Mills, Tanneries, etc.)
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify if the factory falls under the scheduled list (e.g., Engineering, Chemical).
2. Provide lockers, pegs, or separate rooms for keeping clothing not worn during work.
3. Provide facilities for drying wet clothing.
4. Ensure arrangements are approved by the Chief Inspector.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Presence of lockers/pegs/drying rooms

legal_text: All classes of factories mentioned in the schedule annexed hereto shall provide facilities for keeping clothing not worn during working hours and for the drying of wet clothing. Such facilities shall include the provisions of separate rooms, pegs, lockers or other arrangement approved by the Chief Inspector.

question_text: Are first-aid boxes provided at the correct scale and stocked with the prescribed contents based on the number of workers?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Determine the number of workers to select the correct standard (Scale A: <=10, B: 11-50, C: >50).
2. Ensure at least one box is provided for every 150 workers.
3. Check contents against the list in Rule 76 (dressings, antiseptics, scissors, eye-pads, etc.).
4. Mark the box with a red cross on a white background.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Fully stocked first-aid boxes in designated locations

legal_text: The first aid boxes or cupboards shall be distinctively marked with a red cross on a white background and shall contain the following equipment... (A) For factories in which the number of persons employed does not exceed ten... (C) For factories employing more than fifty persons...

question_text: Is a notice containing the names of first-aid trained personnel and the nearest hospital details displayed near every first-aid box?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Prepare a notice listing the names of persons trained in first-aid.
2. Include the workroom location where they are available.
3. Include the name and telephone number of the nearest hospital.
4. Paste this notice conspicuously near every first-aid box.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Notice displayed near first-aid boxes

legal_text: A notice containing the names of the persons working within the precincts of the factory who are trained in first-aid treatment and who are in-charge of the first-aid boxes or cupboards shall be pasted in every factory at a conspicuous place and near each such box or cupboard.

question_text: Is an ambulance room provided with the prescribed equipment and medical staff in factories employing more than 500 workers?
applicability_criteria: Factories employing more than 500 workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify worker count exceeds 500.
2. Provide a separate ambulance room (min 24 sq. meters).
3. Ensure it is in charge of a qualified medical practitioner and nurse.
4. Equip it with the items listed in Rule 78(3) (couch, stretcher, oxygen, surgical instruments, etc.).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Physical existence of Ambulance Room; Staff qualification certificates

legal_text: The ambulance room or dispensary shall be in-charge of a qualified medical practitioner assisted by at least one qualified nurse... It shall have a floor area of at least 24 square metres... and the room shall contain at least... [items listed i to xliv]...

question_text: Is an adequate canteen provided and maintained for the use of workers in factories employing more than 250 workers?
applicability_criteria: Factories employing more than 250 workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify worker count exceeds 250.
2. Ensure a canteen is constructed in accordance with approved plans.
3. Check that it accommodates at least 30% of workers at a time.
4. Ensure it is operational within 6 months of notification.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Physical existence of canteen; Approved plans
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Construction timeline approved by Chief Inspector

legal_text: The occupier of every factory wherein more than 250 workers are ordinarily employed and which is specified by the State Government by a notification in this behalf shall provide, in or near the factory, an adequate canteen according to the standards prescribed in the Rules.

question_text: Is the canteen building situated at least 15 meters away from sources of dust, smoke, or obnoxious fumes (e.g., latrines, boiler house)?
applicability_criteria: Factories with a canteen
simplified_guidance:
1. Measure the distance from the canteen to latrines, urinals, boiler house, coal stacks, etc.
2. Ensure the distance is not less than 15 meters.
3. If closer, check for relaxation approval from the Chief Inspector.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Site plan showing distances; Visual verification
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Approval letter for relaxation of distance

legal_text: The canteen building shall be situated not less than 15 metres from the latrine, urinal, boiler house, coal stacks, ash dumps and any other source of dust, smoke or obnoxious fumes...

question_text: Are the inside walls of the canteen kitchen lime-washed at least once every four months, and other areas annually/triennially?
applicability_criteria: All factory canteens
simplified_guidance:
1. Check the maintenance schedule.
2. Ensure kitchen walls are lime-washed every 4 months.
3. Ensure dining hall walls are lime-washed annually or painted every 3 years.
4. Verify entries in the Register in Form 8.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 8 (Record of lime-washing) with specific entries for canteen

legal_text: All inside walls or rooms and all ceilings... shall be lime-washed or colour-washed at least once in each year... Provided that inside walls of the kitchen shall be lime-washed once every four months. Records of dates... shall be maintained in the prescribed Register in Form 8.

question_text: Has a Canteen Managing Committee been constituted with equal representation from management and workers?
applicability_criteria: Factories with a canteen (unless managed by a Co-operative Society)
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify constitution of the committee.
2. Ensure equal number of members from occupier and workers.
3. Verify worker members are elected.
4. Check that the committee is consulted on menu, quality, and prices.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Minutes of Canteen Managing Committee meetings; List of members

legal_text: The Manager shall appoint a Canteen Managing Committee which shall be consulted from time to time... The Canteen Managing Committee shall consist of an equal number of persons nominated by the occupier and elected... by the workers...

question_text: Are food and items in the canteen sold on a non-profit basis, excluding costs of rent, depreciation, and utilities?
applicability_criteria: All factory canteens
simplified_guidance:
1. Review the pricing policy of the canteen.
2. Ensure prices do not include rent, building maintenance, equipment cost, or utilities (water/lighting).
3. Check if prices are displayed conspicuously.
4. If Co-op society managed, profit up to 5% is allowed.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Audited accounts; Price list displayed

legal_text: Food, drink and other items served in the canteen shall be sold on non-profit basis and in computing the charges... the following items shall not be taken into consideration... rent... depreciation... cost of purchase... water charges...

question_text: Are shelters, rest-rooms, and lunch-rooms provided for workers in factories employing more than 150 workers?
applicability_criteria: Factories employing more than 150 workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify worker count exceeds 150.
2. Ensure adequate shelters or rest-rooms are provided.
3. Check standards: sound construction, 1.1 sq. meter floor area per person.
4. Ensure rooms are furnished with chairs/benches with back-rests.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Physical existence of rest-rooms/lunch-rooms with furniture

legal_text: The shelters, or rest- rooms and lunch-rooms shall conform to the following standards... height... not be less than 3.75 metres... at least 11,000 square centimetres of floor area for every person employed... adequately furnished with chairs or benches with back-rests.

question_text: Is a creche provided and maintained in factories employing more than 30 women workers?
applicability_criteria: Factories employing more than 30 women workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Count women workers.
2. If >30, provide a creche.
3. Ensure it is well-lighted, ventilated, and soundly constructed.
4. Ensure floor area is at least 2 sq. meters per child (min 10 sq. meters total).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Physical creche facility; Attendance register of children

legal_text: The building in which the creche is situated shall be soundly constructed... The height... not less than 3.75 metres... and there shall be not less than 2 square metres of floor area for each child... [subject to the condition that the area of the creche shall not be less than 10 square metres]

question_text: Are children in the creche provided with at least 300ml of milk daily and wholesome refreshment?
applicability_criteria: Factories with a creche
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify supply of 300ml pure milk per child per day.
2. For children above 2 years, ensure additional refreshment is provided.
3. Allow mothers 2 intervals of 15 mins to feed children.
4. Maintain records of supplies.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Purchase records for milk/snacks; Feeding logs

legal_text: At least 300 millitres of clean pure milk shall be available for each child on every day it is accommodated in the creche... For children above two years of age there shall be provided in addition an adequate supply of wholesome refreshment.

question_text: Is the creche managed by a qualified woman in-charge and assisted by female attendants?
applicability_criteria: Factories with a creche
simplified_guidance:
1. Check qualifications of the woman in-charge (Midwife or trained pre-primary teacher).
2. Verify employment of adequate female attendants.
3. Ensure staff wears clean clothes while on duty.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Staff qualification certificates; Muster roll

legal_text: For each creche there shall be appointed a woman in-charge and adequate number of female-attendants to help the woman in-charge... no woman shall be appointed... as a woman in-charge of a creche unless she possesses the qualifications prescribed for a mid-wife...

question_text: Is a notice displayed regarding compensatory holidays for workers who lost weekly holidays, showing the dates of the allowed holidays?
applicability_criteria: Factories where workers are deprived of weekly holidays due to exemptions
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify workers who lost weekly holidays in the previous month.
2. Prepare a notice showing the dates of compensatory holidays to be allowed.
3. Display this notice before the end of the month in which holidays were lost.
4. Ensure the notice is displayed at the place where the Notice of Periods of Work is displayed.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Displayed Notice of Compensatory Holidays
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Records of holidays lost and due

legal_text: The manager of the factory shall display, on or before the end of the month in which holidays are lost, a notice in respect of workers allowed compensatory holidays during the following month and of the dates thereof, at the place at which the Notice of Periods of Work prescribed under section 61 is displayed.

question_text: Are overtime slips issued in duplicate to workers immediately after the completion of overtime work?
applicability_criteria: Factories where workers perform overtime work
simplified_guidance:
1. Record any work done beyond normal periods in overtime slips.
2. Prepare slips in duplicate.
3. Ensure the slip indicates the actual period of overtime worked.
4. Provide one signed copy to the worker immediately after the work (or weekly if approved by Chief Inspector).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Counterfoils/Copies of issued overtime slips signed by manager

legal_text: Any work done by a worker beyond the normal specified period of work shall be entered in the overtime slips in duplicate indicating therein the actual period of overtime worked by him. A copy of such overtime slip... shall be given to the worker immediately after completion of the overtime work...

question_text: Is the Notice of Periods of Work for adult workers displayed in Form 16?
applicability_criteria: All factories employing adult workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Prepare Form 16 indicating starting, stopping, and rest intervals.
2. Ensure it covers all groups and relays.
3. Display it conspicuously at the factory entrance.
4. Ensure strict adherence to the displayed timings.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 16 displayed at the main entrance
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Draft notice awaiting approval (if changes pending)

legal_text: The notice of periods of work for adult workers shall be in Form 16.

question_text: Is the Register of Adult Workers maintained in Form 17 and written up afresh each year?
applicability_criteria: All factories employing adult workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Maintain a register in Form 17.
2. Ensure details of every adult worker are entered.
3. Write up the register afresh every calendar year.
4. Preserve the register for 12 months after the last entry.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Current year's Form 17 Register

legal_text: The register of adult workers shall be in Form 17. This register shall be written up afresh each year and shall be preserved for a period of twelve months.

question_text: Is a list maintained showing the names and designations of persons holding positions of supervision, management, or confidential positions?
applicability_criteria: All factories claiming exemptions for supervisory/confidential staff (under Section 64)
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify staff defined under Rule 100 (Managers, Engineers, Foremen, etc.).
2. Prepare a list of their names and designations.
3. Maintain this list and make it available for inspection.
4. Ensure these persons meet the criteria of not performing manual/clerical work as a regular duty.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: List of exempt persons (Supervisory/Confidential)

legal_text: A list showing the names and designations of all persons defined in rule 100 shall be maintained in every factory and it shall be made available for inspection to the Inspector at all times when work is being carried on in any factory.

question_text: Is the Notice of Periods of Work for child workers displayed in Form 18?
applicability_criteria: Factories employing child workers (young persons under 15)
simplified_guidance:
1. If children are employed, prepare Form 18.
2. Ensure working hours comply with Section 71 (max 4.5 hours).
3. Display the notice clearly.
4. Ensure strict compliance with the displayed periods.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 18 displayed (if children employed); OR Statement of non-employment of children

legal_text: The notice of periods of work for child workers shall be in Form 18.

question_text: Is the Register of Child Workers maintained in Form 19?
applicability_criteria: Factories employing child workers
simplified_guidance:
1. Maintain a register in Form 19 for all child workers.
2. Record details including nature of work, group, and certificate of fitness number.
3. Write up the register afresh each year.
4. Preserve it for 12 months.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 19 Register

legal_text: The Register of child-workers shall be in Form 19. This register shall be written up afresh each year and shall be preserved for a period of twelve months.

question_text: Is the Leave with Wages Register maintained in Form 20 for all eligible workers?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Maintain a register in Form 20 called the Leave with Wages Register.
2. Ensure it is preserved for 3 years after the last entry.
3. Verify that entries regarding earned leave, leave taken, and wages paid are updated.
4. Ensure the register is readily available for inspection.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 20 Register (physical or digital if approved)

legal_text: The manager shall keep a Register in Form 20 hereinafter called the Leave with Wages Register: Provided that if the Chief Inspector is of the opinion that any duly maintained Leave Register or Muster Roll... gives the particulars required... he may, by order in writing, allow such Leave Register or Muster Roll to be maintained in place of the Register in Form 20.

question_text: Is a Leave Book in Form 20 provided to every worker who has become entitled to leave?
applicability_criteria: All factories (for workers entitled to leave)
simplified_guidance:
1. Provide each eligible worker with a Leave Book (Form 20).
2. Ensure the book is a thick bound copy or in a durable format.
3. Make the property of the worker and ensure the manager (or agent) does not demand it except to make entries.
4. Update entries within one week of leave being taken.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Workers confirming possession of Leave Books; Inspection of Leave Books

legal_text: The manager shall provide each worker who has become entitled to leave during a calendar year, with a book in Form 20 (hereinafter called the Leave Book) not later than the 31st January of the following calendar year. The Leave Book shall be the property of the worker...

question_text: Is a notice sent to the Inspector in every case of lay-off, and are entries made in the Leave Registers?
applicability_criteria: Factories where lay-off of workers occurs
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify cases of lay-off (by agreement, contract, or standing orders).
2. Send a notice to the Inspector as soon as possible.
3. Include the number of workers and reasons for lay-off in the notice.
4. Record the lay-off details in the Leave with Wages Register and the worker's Leave Book.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of Lay-off Notice sent to Inspector; Form 20 entries

legal_text: The manager shall give, as soon as possible, a notice to the Inspector of every case of lay- off of workers by agreement or contract or as permissible under the standing orders, giving the number of such workers and the reasons for the lay-off. Entries to this effect shall be made in the Leave with Wages Register and the Leave Book in respect of each worker concerned.

question_text: In cases where leave is refused or postponed, is the fact and reason recorded in the Leave with Wages Register and Leave Book?
applicability_criteria: Factories where worker leave requests are refused or postponed
simplified_guidance:
1. Review leave applications (Form 15 or written request).
2. If leave is refused or postponed, record the decision.
3. Enter the reasons for refusal/postponement in the Leave with Wages Register (Form 20).
4. Enter the same in the worker's Leave Book.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 20 Register showing reasons for refused leave

legal_text: Where a worker is refused leave... or where his leave is postponed, a record of the fact and of the reason of such refusal or postponement shall be made in the Leave with Wages Register and in the Leave Book.

question_text: In case of a worker's death, are the balance of leave wages paid to the nominee or legal heir within one week?
applicability_criteria: Factories where a worker has died while in service
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify any worker deaths in the audit period.
2. Calculate the balance of wages due for the period of leave.
3. Pay the amount to the nominee or legal heir.
4. Ensure payment is made within one week of intimation of death.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Payment receipt signed by nominee/heir; Bank transfer record

legal_text: In case a worker dies while he is in service, the manager shall pay the balance of wages due for the period of leave... to his nominee... within one week of the intimation of the death of the worker.

question_text: If the factory is exempted under section 84, is a register maintained showing full particulars of leave?
applicability_criteria: Factories granted exemption from Chapter VIII (Leave with Wages)
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify if the factory has an exemption order under Section 84.
2. Maintain a register showing leave due, taken, and wages paid.
3. Ensure it contains all particulars necessary to establish compliance with the exemption order.
4. Keep it available for inspection.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Register maintained as per exemption conditions
