legal_text: Where an exemption is granted under section 84, the manager shall maintain a Register showing the position of each worker as regards leave due, leave taken and wages granted.

question_text: Is the Annual Return in Form 27 submitted to the Inspector on or before the 1st of February each year?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Compile data regarding workers, leave, accidents, and canteen facilities.
2. Complete Form 27 in duplicate.
3. Submit to the Inspector or designated officer by 1st February.
4. Retain acknowledgement of submission.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of submitted Form 27 with acknowledgement
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Proof of late submission fee payment (if applicable)

legal_text: The manager of every factory shall furnish to the Inspector... the following returns, namely:- (1) Annual returns - On or before the 1st February of each year, an annual return in duplicate in Form 27 relating to the following matters...

question_text: Is a muster-roll of all workers employed in the factory maintained in Form 29?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Maintain a muster-roll in Form 29 for all workers.
2. Ensure entries include name, nature of work, and daily attendance.
3. Verify that entries are made at the commencement of each period of work.
4. Keep the roll available for inspection for 3 years.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 29 Muster Roll updated daily

legal_text: The manager of every factory shall maintain a muster-roll of all the workers employed in the factory in Form 29 showing (a) the name of each worker, (b) the nature of his work, and (c) the daily attendance of the worker.

question_text: Is the Register of Accidents and Dangerous Occurrences maintained in Form 30?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Maintain Form 30 (Register of Accidents).
2. Record details of every accident or dangerous occurrence.
3. Ensure entries match the notifications sent in Forms 24/24A.
4. Preserve the register for 3 years.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 30 Register with up-to-date entries

legal_text: The manager of every factory shall maintain a Register of all accidents and dangerous occurrences which occur in the factory in Form 30...

question_text: Are fatal or serious accidents reported to the Inspector within 4 hours via telephone, followed by a written report in Form 24 within 12 hours?
applicability_criteria: Factories where a fatal or serious accident occurs
simplified_guidance:
1. In case of death or serious injury, notify the Inspector within 4 hours by telephone/telegram.
2. Also notify the District Magistrate and Police Station.
3. Submit written report in Form 24 within 12 hours.
4. 'Serious nature' includes loss of limb, unconsciousness, or severe burns.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of Form 24 submitted; Proof of telephone/telegram intimation

legal_text: Where any accident specified in sub-clause (a) of clause 1 of the Schedule... occurs in a factory, the manager of the factory shall within 4 hours of the occurrence of the accident give notice... by telephone, telegram... and... send a written report in Form 24 within 12 hours...

question_text: Are dangerous occurrences (e.g., vessel bursting, fire, explosion) reported to the Inspector in Form 24A within 24 hours?
applicability_criteria: Factories where a dangerous occurrence (as per Schedule) takes place
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify if the event falls under the Schedule (bursting of vessel, collapse of hoist, fire/explosion, etc.).
2. Notify the Inspector within 4 hours (if required by severity) or standard 24 hours.
3. Submit written report in Form 24A within 24 hours.
4. Record in Form 30.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of Form 24A submitted; Incident investigation report

legal_text: The following classes of dangerous occurrences, whether or not they are attended by personal injury or disablement... Bursting of a vessel... Collapse or failure of a crane... Explosion or fire... [require notification].

question_text: Is the Notice of Poisoning or Disease submitted in Form 25 upon detection of any notifiable disease?
applicability_criteria: Factories where workers contract notifiable diseases (Third Schedule of the Act)
simplified_guidance:
1. Monitor health records for signs of notifiable diseases (e.g., lead poisoning, silicosis).
2. If a case is detected/suspected, complete Form 25.
3. Send the notice to the Chief Inspector and Certifying Surgeon.
4. Take corrective measures to prevent spread.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of Form 25 submitted

legal_text: Notice of poisoning or disease... shall be in Form 25.

question_text: Is the Abstract of the Factories Act and Rules displayed in Form 26 at a conspicuous place?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Obtain the Abstract in Form 26 (English and local language).
2. Display it near the main entrance or a conspicuous location.
3. Ensure it is legible and not torn/defaced.
4. Replace if damaged.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Form 26 displayed prominently

legal_text: The abstract of the Act and of the Rules required to be displayed in every factory shall be in Form 26.

question_text: Is the Inspection Book maintained in Form 31 and produced for the Inspector/Certifying Surgeon?
applicability_criteria: All factories
simplified_guidance:
1. Maintain an Inspection Book in Form 31.
2. Ensure it is bound and pages are consecutively numbered.
3. Produce it whenever an Inspector or Certifying Surgeon visits.
4. Report loss of the book immediately to the Inspector.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Physical Inspection Book (Form 31)

legal_text: The Manager of every factory shall maintain a bound Inspection Book in Form 31... The Inspection Book shall be produced to the Inspector or Certifying Surgeon when required by him.

question_text: Is information regarding intended closure of the factory (or department) sent to the Inspector prior to closure?
applicability_criteria: Factories intending to close or suspend work (other than temporary)
simplified_guidance:
1. Decide on the closure date.
2. Send information in duplicate to the Inspector immediately after decision and before closure.
3. State date, reasons, workers affected, and probable period.
4. Also report re-opening in the annual return.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of closure notice submitted to Inspector

legal_text: The occupier and the manager shall be jointly or severally responsible for sending information in duplicate to the Inspector, of any intended closure of the factory or any shift, section or department thereof... before the closure takes place...
